description: A visual guide to Donald J. Trump’s first visit to his hometown as president.
title: It’s Trump’s First Trip Back to New York. Here’s What to Expect.
title_page: It’s Trump’s First Trip Back to New York. Here’s What to Expect. - The New York Times
text:
This is President Trump’s updated itinerary as of 1:30 p.m.
6:15 p.m.1 Kennedy International Airport Mr. Trump arrives.
7:15 p.m.2 Intrepid Meets with Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull of Australia.
7:45 p.m.2 Intrepid Makes remarks commemorating the Battle of the Coral Sea 75 years ago.
9 p.m.3 Bedminster, N.J. Travels to country home at the Trump National Golf Club.
Protests and Traffic Disruptions
W 59 St Trump Tower W 57 St. Planned protest Hudson River W 55 St Planned protest 10 Ave 7 Ave W 50 St Intrepid W 45 St AREA OF DETAIL Planned protest W 59 St Trump Tower W 57 St. Hudson River W 55 St Planned protest Planned protest 7 Ave W 50 St 10 Ave Intrepid W 45 St Planned protest AREA OF DETAIL W 42 St Trump Tower W 57 St. Planned protest Planned protest W 50 St Intrepid 5 Ave Planned protest W 42 St 10 Ave W 34 St AREA OF DETAIL
Mr. Trump’s already short trip was cut even shorter early Thursday afternoon when the White House announced he would remain in Washington for longer than expected. Still, the trip has the potential to cause major disruptions, including street closings and protests near the Intrepid that could bring traffic on the West Side Highway to a standstill.
Mr. Trump was originally scheduled to arrive at J.F.K. around 3 p.m. and travel via helicopter to the Peninsula Hotel to meet with Mr. Turnbull (the hotel is on Fifth Avenue, one block south of Trump Tower, where Mr. Trump lived and worked until his inauguration). From there, the president, Melania Trump, Mr. Turnbull and his wife were going to travel by motorcade to the Intrepid.

Protesters have gathered around Trump Tower and outside the Intrepid. Several security measures, including heavily armed police officers at each entrance, are still in place to protect the first lady, Mrs. Trump, and their son Barron, who continue to live in the building.
Weekend at Bedminster Golf Club
Mr. Trump stays in one of the cottages surrounding the pool. Trump National GOLF Club, Bedminster Clubhouse Mr. Trump stays in one of the cottages surrounding the pool. Trump National GOLF Club, Bedminster Clubhouse Mr. Trump stays in one of the cottages surrounding the pool. Trump National GOLF Club, Bedminster Clubhouse
With Mar-a-Lago, Mr. Trump’s exclusive resort in Palm Beach, Fla., soon closing for the season, the president is expected to spend more time, including this weekend, at his New Jersey club. The centerpiece of the golf course is the clubhouse, a 1939 red brick mansion in the Georgian Revival-style where Mr. Trump hosted a procession of potential officials for his administration before his inauguration.
